author: leoyoung
content: Hi I have a question on fees. Currently, users can pay fees by DAI or USDT. Can non-ether tokens still be used to pay gas fees after eip1559?

author: pietjepuk
content: Currently, and also after EIP-1559, the protocol does not allow payments in anything other than ETH. So this will remain unchanged. The thing that will change is that, after EIP-1559, the protocol will enforce a minimum amount of payment/cost in ETH (the base fee) based on demand. Currently, there is no such minimum, and a miner could charge themselves (net-)zero ETH and/or take payment on the side in some other currency.

author: ethereumdegen
content: Where a transaction relayer accepts payment in a token to submit a real tx to ethereum mainnet on your behalf and burn their eth to do so.

author: timbeiko
content: Yep, exactly. It just means the miners have to actually have the ETH and burn it vs. simply pay the "opportunity cost" of not including a txn with a high gas price.
